readings: A paper to be assigned as example

topics: Description of Topic and Supporting Research
assignments: Draft version of the final document/paper
Presentation of the results of the research/project

grading.policies: 25% of the total points will be deducted for late assignments.

assignments.due_date: 2 weeks before end of the course

policies.late_work: 25% of the total points will be deducted for late assignments.
policies.academic_integrity: All Stevens graduate students promise to be fully truthful and avoid dishonesty, fraud, misrepresentation, and deceit of any type in relation to their academic work.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology is dedicated to providing appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.technology_requirements: Basic computer and web-browsing skills, navigating Canvas, live web conferencing using Zoom, recording a slide presentation with audio narration, recording, editing, and uploading video via Kaltura.
additional_info.support_resources: For more information about course access or support, contact the Technology Resource and Assistance Center (TRAC) by calling 201-216-5500.

_metadata.course_description: This course is on a 'special project' and it has the following main components: Define how a project-oriented topic should be developed, Define criteria and methods to determine the topic and the data sources for the project, Develop a project on the selected topic.
learning_outcomes: Frame complex problems into research steps
Match research questions with data to support the process to address them
Prepare the data for the analysis
Create a model to extract the metrics required to address the research questions
Create visualizations as needed to better present the value of the metrics in addressing the questions
Create a narrative to frame the findings and addressing the questions in a plain readable format
Place information in the context of the defined issues as they work to rebuild/build.
Solve complex problems for the immediacy and in relation to the larger picture.
prerequisites: This is a capstone project, to be taken close to the end of the program
